results.title: Great Barrier Reef: marvels in miniature

results.title: The Marvellous march of Jean Francois
results.creator_credit: Witold Giersz, Israel M. Berman and Sterling International
results.brief_description: The wonderful adventures of Jean Francois, a small drummer boy in Napoleon’s Grande Armee. Ingenuity and steadfastness lead Jean Francois around the world and through the peril of war and the elements back to his homeland.

results.title: Marriage today
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Irving Jacoby and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mcgraw Hill”.
Analysis of the married relationship of tow couples who have made their partnership work through a clear analysis of their mutual aims and co-operation in striving to achieve these aims. Neither of these marriages is perfect, for there are bound to be conflicts where different personalities are involved. But these people have their ideals and goals in true perspective and they are willing to work together to reach them.

results.title: Man's experience of the world
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Two interviews with a businessman approaching the end of his successful career and an occupant of a rural commune to study the differences between them and how they relate to the themes in the unit being studied, ie the Social Science Course.

results.title: The management of work centres for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: Michael Holmes, Francis Haveron, Heron Film Productions and United Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Describes the process of management through the management committee, the work centre manager and his staff. It shows work produced by physically handicapped workers which includes packing, assembling wire products, various machine operations and handicrafts.

results.title: Management and top-dressing of pastures
results.brief_description: Stresses the need for pastoralists to maintain their grasslands once established. Shows the use of superphosphate in seeding, also lime and trace elements (in this case, molybdenum). While showing the use of an electric fence for regulated use of pasture, the film warns against overgrazing of the resulting strips. Also explains the need to let grass mature to maximum feed value, and to keep down weeds. Suggests that farmers should grow and store surplus feed.

results.title: A Man of the world: H.H. the Aga Khan
results.creator_credit: Georges Robin, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
The Aga Khan is the creator of one of the world’s most dramatic and imaginative development schemes - a planned riviera along 35 miles of Sardinia’s Costa Smeralda. He is also the spiritual leader of more than 12 million Ismaili-Muslims scattered around the world, and a wealthy Parisian, racehourse owner, and Olympic skier. Shows the Aga Khan in a variety of activities. He comments personally, analysing himself and his different faces with the same detached lucidity he brings to all his undertakings.
results.title_for_label: A Man of the world: H.H. the Aga Khan
